meta.description: Contract timing analysis for extension decisions
meta.methodology: Based on development curves and salary allocation data

rules.rationale: QB is hard to replace via draft/FA
OL is hard to replace via draft/FA
EDGE is hard to replace via draft/FA

QB.explanation: Cheap contract, player developing toward peak
QB.strategy: Maximize playing time, evaluate for extension
Extend before FA if above-average player

QB.explanation: Paying market rate for peak production
QB.strategy: Only extend if elite; otherwise let FA determine value

RB.explanation: Cheap contract, player developing toward peak
RB.strategy: Maximize playing time, evaluate for extension
Extend before FA if above-average player

RB.explanation: Paying market rate for peak production
RB.strategy: Only extend if elite; otherwise let FA determine value
Do not extend; replace via draft

WR.explanation: Cheap contract, player developing toward peak
WR.strategy: Maximize playing time, evaluate for extension
Extend before FA if above-average player

WR.explanation: Paying market rate for peak production
WR.strategy: Only extend if elite; otherwise let FA determine value
Short deal only if no replacement ready

TE.strategy: Only extend if elite; otherwise let FA determine value

general_principles: Extend players BEFORE peak to capture prime at pre-prime cost
Shorter deals for fast-declining positions (RB, CB)
Longer deals OK for slow-declining positions (QB, OL)
Replacement difficulty should influence willingness to pay

extend_aggressively.reason: Hard to replace via draft/FA, slow decline

avoid_extensions.reason: Easy to replace, fast decline (RB/CB) or deep position (LB)

red_flags: Never give long deals to RBs over 26 (12%/year decline)
Avoid guaranteeing years past prime end for any position
Don't pay market rate for players 2+ years past peak
best_practices: Use franchise tag to bridge extension negotiations at peak
Structure deals with declining cap hits (front-load)
Include performance incentives for aging players
Plan replacement 2 years before expected decline
